title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power received approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage facility in Everett on former ExxonMobil site.
The storage system will feature 816 lithium-ion battery enclosures and span 16.5 of the 20.75-acre site.
Everett's project includes two substations and connects with the Eversource Mystic Substation for improved energy distribution.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Feb. 28, with musical guest Mumford & Sons.
Storrie's 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams joined him on stage for a skating-centric sketch.
Olympic hockey players, including Megan Keller and Hilary Knight, appeared wearing their gold medals during the monologue.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Revolution lost 1-0 to Red Bulls at Sports Illustrated Stadium, facing back-to-back defeats to start the 2026 season.
Revolution defenders Ceballos and Fofana returned, helping to fend off numerous Red Bulls' attacks despite a possession disadvantage.
New England's Carles Gil struggled with accuracy against New York's pressing defense, missing key passes during the game.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas is unlikely to make the Opening Day roster after tearing his patellar tendon last May.
Pitchers Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval are progressing in their rehab, both recently throwing live batting practice.
Boston Red Sox's roster decisions are impacted by offseason acquisitions and the rehabs of Casas, Crawford, and Sandoval.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs cameras on school bus stop arms to catch drivers who illegally pass stopped buses.
The system, in partnership with BusPatrol, automatically activates when a bus extends its stop sign arm.
The initiative follows pilot programs showing high rates of violations, with 2.3 illegal passes per bus per day recorded.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed to a sold-out crowd at Mohegan Sun Arena, featuring a mix of blues and ballads.
Stapleton performed solo and with an eight-piece band, including his wife Morgane, with a setlist spanning his career.
Fan reactions were enthusiastic, particularly during crowd favorites like 'Tennessee Whiskey' and an unexpected 'Free Bird' rendition.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The New England Patriots may cut or trade players to create cap space for 2026 free agency.
Stefon Diggs's contract might make him a cut candidate despite his strong performance; cutting saves $16.8 million.
Christian Elliss could be released due to cap savings and depth chart changes despite $8.5 million cap number.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not make his season debut against the 76ers as he recovers from a right Achilles injury.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid will also miss Sunday's game due to an oblique strain, impacting the 76ers' lineup.
The Celtics, having won eight of their last ten games, are currently second in the Eastern Conference standings.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit three home runs in the first week of Red Sox spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
Duran's career struggled against lefties, with a .232 batting average and just eight homers in 558 plate appearances.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora considers Duran a strong candidate for the lineup's third spot following his impressive spring performance.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored a combined 39 goals for Boston College this season.
Letourneau has improved significantly, scoring 19 goals this season compared to zero goals as a freshman.
With their improving college prospects, the Bruins are enhancing their talent pipeline, promising future NHL impact.
